column5: This was my third trip up that way and the bite was on. There were 8 of us and at some points double and triple headers in different boats at the same time, most around 21/2 or 3lbs with the biggest at 4.7lbs, it was beauty. All trolling the mouth of the river, possession limits adhered too and allot put back. 1 taged pickerel was caught and tag sent to the MNR in New Liskeard. Pictures will tell the story...   my first day   average size   some stringers put together for a photo   Pub lunch - wings,fresh cut fries,pickerel and refreshing beverages "oh yeah"          Weather was good, not much wind, a bit too hot mid-day for being in the boat but most of the action was morning and early evening and at times allot of other boats came by to try their luck.  It was a great trip with a good time had by all.  Hope you enjoy... Bill.
So thats what retired people do!!!!!!!.........NICE

Nice job Bill!  I was a few miles south of you on the Ottawa River in Temiskaming on Sat..  nothing but tiny saugers and one small pickerel the entire day.  I guess I know where all the big fish are.  What did you get them on?  cranks?  harnesses?  Ours came on nice sized chubs and a few on the leech.
Peter, life is good... I'm thinking Lakair G2G next year...  Bill, all were caught trolling deepdiving cranks and we where on the Quebec side...
Beauty report Bill Some real nice eyes in those pics Doesn't get any better than that!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice trip Bill. Thanks for the photos.
I was thinking about buying some land 5 miles from there. I think you just made up my mind
Nice eyes guys. Thanks for posting
Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm   thats one tasty shore lunch!    we used to have a camp up there, man i miss it!

NICE!!  Was there a coupla weeks ago and did well in Waby Bay..  Was wondering though.  I'm not sure I recognize what river mouth that is...  One of the shots looks like it could be Dawson Point..  A PM would be really kewl.  cheers!! HD
Great report Bill!!.....looks like a a good time had by all and lot's of nice eyes....I was getting hungry just looking at that stringer!.....thanks for sharing your trip
